flights_information.name: Voyager 1
flights_information.details: Voyager 1 is a space probe launched by NASA to study the outer Solar System, including Jupiter, Saturn, and beyond. It is currently the farthest human-made object from Earth.

flights_information.name: Apollo 11
flights_information.details: Apollo 11 was the first crewed mission to land on the Moon, with astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin making history by walking on its surface while Michael Collins orbited above in the command module.

flights_information.name: Mars Rover Perseverance
flights_information.mission: Seek signs of ancient life and collect samples of rock and regolith for possible return to Earth.
flights_information.details: Perseverance is a Mars rover mission by NASA's Mars Exploration Program. It aims to study the geology, climate, and potential habitability of Mars, as well as pave the way for human exploration of the planet.

flights_information.name: Hubble Space Telescope
flights_information.mission: Observe the most distant galaxies and study the atmospheres of exoplanets
flights_information.details: The Hubble Space Telescope is a large space telescope launched into low Earth orbit in 1990. It has provided some of the most detailed images of distant galaxies, nebulae, and other celestial objects, revolutionizing our understanding of the universe.

flights_information.name: Galileo
flights_information.details: Galileo was an unmanned spacecraft sent by NASA to study the planet Jupiter and its moons. It provided valuable data on Jupiter's atmosphere, magnetosphere, and the Galilean moons.

flights_information.name: New Horizons
flights_information.mission: Explore Pluto and the Kuiper Belt
flights_information.details: New Horizons is a NASA spacecraft that conducted a flyby study of the dwarf planet Pluto and its moons in 2015. It is now exploring the Kuiper Belt, providing valuable data on these distant icy bodies.

flights_information.name: Cassini-Huygens
flights_information.details: Cassini-Huygens was a joint NASA-ESA mission to study the planet Saturn and its moons. The Cassini orbiter provided unprecedented insights into Saturn's atmosphere, rings, and moons, while the Huygens probe landed on Titan, Saturn's largest moon.

flights_information.name: SpaceX Dragon
flights_information.mission: Cargo resupply to the International Space Station
flights_information.details: Dragon is a spacecraft developed by SpaceX for cargo resupply missions to the International Space Station (ISS). It is capable of carrying both pressurized and unpressurized cargo, and it plays a crucial role in supporting ISS operations.

flights_information.name: Juno
flights_information.mission: Study Jupiter's composition, gravity field, magnetic field, and polar magnetosphere
flights_information.details: Juno is a NASA spacecraft launched to study Jupiter's composition, gravity field, magnetic field, and polar magnetosphere. By orbiting Jupiter, Juno aims to improve our understanding of the planet's formation and evolution.

flights_information.name: Pioneer 10
flights_information.mission: First spacecraft to travel through the asteroid belt and make direct observations of Jupiter
flights_information.details: Pioneer 10 was the first spacecraft to travel through the asteroid belt and make direct observations of Jupiter. It provided valuable data on the gas giant before its mission ended in 2003.

flights_information.name: Viking 1
flights_information.mission: Landed on Mars and conducted the first successful Mars lander mission
flights_information.details: Viking 1 was the first spacecraft to successfully land on Mars and perform experiments on its surface. It provided valuable data on Martian soil and atmosphere, paving the way for future Mars missions.

flights_information.name: Chang'e 4
flights_information.mission: First soft landing on the far side of the Moon
flights_information.details: Chang'e 4 is a Chinese lunar exploration mission that achieved the first soft landing on the far side of the Moon. It aims to study the geology, environment, and resources of this previously unexplored lunar region.

flights_information.name: Crew Dragon Demo-2
flights_information.mission: First crewed test flight of Crew Dragon spacecraft
flights_information.details: Crew Dragon Demo-2 was the first crewed test flight of SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft, carrying NASA astronauts to and from the International Space Station. It marked a significant milestone in NASA's Commercial Crew Program.

flights_information.name: Vega
flights_information.mission: European launcher for small satellites to low Earth orbit
flights_information.details: Vega is a European launcher designed to carry small satellites to low Earth orbit. It provides a flexible and cost-effective launch solution for scientific, commercial, and educational payloads.

flights_information.name: Pioneer 11
flights_information.mission: Explored the outer Solar System, including Jupiter, Saturn, and its moon Titan
flights_information.details: Pioneer 11 was a spacecraft launched to explore the outer Solar System, including Jupiter, Saturn, and its moon Titan. It provided valuable data on these distant worlds before its mission ended in 1995.
